<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FED
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/senate-banking-committee-approves-controversial-trump-nomination-fed-board?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Banking Committee Says Gimme Shelton
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Judy Shelton " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzk0L2p1ZHlfc2hlbHRvbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Senate Banking Committee <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/senate-banking-committee-approves-controversial-nominee-judy-shelton-federal-reserve-n1234518?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> President Trump nominee Judy Shelton to the Federal Reserve’s Board of Governors. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shelton got the greenlight by the skin of her teeth—i.e. a party-line 13–12 vote. All 12 of the committee’s Democrats signed a letter to committee chairman Sen. Mike Crapo requesting another hearing.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Three of the committee’s Republicans had previously expressed doubts about Shelton. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">FYI: </strong>The Board of Governors is a seven-member body that oversees the Federal Reserve system, including emergency lending activities and orchestrating monetary policy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Christopher Waller also got the nod to the board, but he’s much less controversial than Shelton. We’ll explain. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Shelton has held some...unorthodox positions</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For a while, she advocated for a return to the gold standard, though more recently she’s backed off that highly unconventional idea. Her views on the Fed’s independence are now causing more sleep loss for legal and economic experts. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The White House and the Fed are traditionally held as far apart as the parking lot and the concert venue. The distance is meant to enable the Fed to make decisions based on long-term economic trends, not short-term political interests. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But Shelton has questioned that separation. And she was an informal adviser to  President Trump’s 2016 campaign, leading some experts </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/07/21/judy-shelton-vote-fed/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to worry</a></span><span> she’d serve his goals. Trump also has been aggressively pressuring current Fed Chair Jerome Powell, which adds to their nightmares of a politicized Fed. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Shelton may rise even higher than the Board. Some think that, if he’s reelected, Trump will nominate Shelton for Powell’s spot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The Fed and the central bankers who comprise it are <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/research/fed-response-to-covid19/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more crucial than ever</a> as lawmakers and economists search for a way out of the current economic crisis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Shelton and Waller’s next (and final) stop on the nomination circuit is the full Senate, where President Trump’s Republican Party has a majority. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/snap-beats-revenue-misses-user-growth?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Snap Breathes In, and Out
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Snap ghost" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzk2L3NuYXBfZ2hvc3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Snap kicked off Q2 earnings for social media companies yesterday, and like receiving a Snapchat from your college ex, it was a mixed bag of emotions.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Revenue increased 17% annually to $454 million, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/snap-revenue-slows-but-sees-advertisers-ramping-up-11595362540?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beating</a> estimates but giving away slowing growth. Snap said advertisers have upped spending in recent weeks, particularly in gaming and e-commerce. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Daily active users were also up 17% to 238 million, right in line with expectations. The company can at least high-five itself for creating a habit: It said the average user opened Snapchat 30x a day in Q2. Speaking of, please close Snapchat and continue reading this email. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The fun stuff</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last month, Snap <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/11/snap-unveils-new-entertainment-gaming-thirdparty-partnerships?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> the “Minis” developer platform, which allows third parties to run applications in Snap’s app. On Monday, the first Mini with meditation app Headspace <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/7/20/21331037/snapchat-headspace-meditation-mini-apps-mental-health?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> with six guided meditation exercises. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three others drop this week, including study aid Flashcards, clairvoyance game Prediction Master, and Let’s Do It, which helps your friends make decisions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Against the backdrop of a Facebook boycott and last week’s Twitter hack, Snap’s holding steady. Its stock is up almost 200% since March and nearing 2017 highs.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/eu-leaders-agree-coronavirus-recovery-package?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
TFW You Have to Save the Continent Over Brunch
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="EU leaders at brunch" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzk3L2V1X2xlYWRlcnNfYXRfYnJ1bmNoLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>FRANCOIS WALSCHAERTS/POOL/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Swap the mimosas for straight OJ, and you just might have a productive morning. On Monday, EU leaders reached an agreement on a momentous $857 billion <a href="https://apnews.com/ac0ed55e49e362593dfe4081f9d84622?utm_source=piano&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=morningwire&pnespid=lvtjsaRfAAmNpZS6uHzPJ5QyaBk8j6X9YkzMGihr&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coronavirus recovery package</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">EU members will sell bonds to raise the funds, which includes ~$450 billion in grants for countries hardest hit by COVID-19.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">They’ll remember this summit for years</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But not because of the chess, wine, movies, and hallway naps. It took four days of tense, draining negotiations for German Chancellor Angela Merkel and French President Emmanuel Macron to get “the frugals”—the Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, Finland, and Austria—on board. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The wealthy northern European countries were reluctant to send money to their southern neighbors and wanted strict spending oversight and labor market and pension reforms. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Italy’s prime minister accused the holdups of “blackmailing” Europe and risking the bloc’s future. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Talks almost disintegrated as sleep-deprived leaders entered day 3. On day 4, aides “combed Brussels for extra underwear and fresh face masks,” Bloomberg <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-21/the-inside-story-of-how-europe-landed-its-massive-stimulus-plan?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But in a testament to the power of the German-French alliance (and a midnight bowl of cherries), a consensus was hammered out on Monday. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/womens-soccer-team-come-los-angeles-2022?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
New Soccer Team or Met Gala?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<img alt="Welcoming Angel City " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzkzL3dlbGNvbWluZ19hbmdlbF9jaXR5LmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NWSL</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the National Women’s Soccer League (NWSL) announced a <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/christinasettimi/2020/07/21/serena-williams-natalie-portman-and-uswnt-legends-part-of-female-ownership-group-bringing-womens-professional-soccer-to-los-angeles/#47d791fd2767?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new team</a> will come to Los Angeles in 2022. The name? Angel City...for now. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>A high-powered group of investors and celebs have been pushing for a Los Angeles women’s soccer team <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/21/vcs-celebrities-and-athletes-are-writing-a-new-la-story-to-bring-womens-soccer-to-the-city/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">for several years</a>. And if you want to start something in LA, you do it through hard work and name dropping. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Oscar winner Natalie Portman and Upfront Ventures partner Kara Nortman started the group with entertainment biz veteran Julie Uhrman, who serves as its president. Tennis superstar Serena Williams, actors such as Uzo Aduba and Eva Longoria, and former USWNT legends such as Mia Hamm and Julie Foudy are also involved. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Williams’s husband, Reddit cofounder Alexis Ohanian, led the investment into Angel City.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With this kind of star power, the now-11 team NWSL is <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/howardmegdal/2020/07/21/nwsl-news-how-natalie-portman-serena-williams-and-nwsl-la-ownership-change-the-league/#38f62b741ab0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ready for the spotlight</a>.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ The team doesn't have a permanent name, </strong>probably because Brew readers haven’t offered suggestions yet. The Los Angeles Açaí Bowls? The Los Angeles Aggressive Drivers? Think about it and get back to us. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>This week, the Brew is previewing next Monday's antitrust hearing by profiling each Big Tech company. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Company name: </strong>Amazon</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Volunteered as tribute: </strong>CEO Jeff Bezos </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The charges: </strong>Amazon is being investigated for allegedly using the data it’s collected on third-party sellers to help it make competing products. It may also be questioned about Amazon Web Services, the immensely profitable cloud unit it uses to subsidize its e-commerce operations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The rebuttal: </strong>Bezos will likely point to a few key stats, including that third-party sellers now outsell Amazon products on Amazon’s own platform, as evidence of Amazon's fair and equitable treatment of those third-party sellers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It gets even juicier. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/antitrust-spotlight-amazon-improperly-abuse-thirdparty-sellers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read all about Bezos in the hot seat</a>. </p>

href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/senate-banking-committee-approves-controversial-nominee-judy-shelton-federal-reserve-n1234518?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e President Trump nominee Judy Shelton to the Federal Reserve’s Board of Governors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShelton got the greenlight by the skin of her teeth—i.e. a party-line 13–12 vote. All 12 of the committee’s Democrats signed a letter to committee chairman Sen. Mike Crapo requesting another hearing.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThree of the committee’s Republicans had previously expressed doubts about Shelton. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFYI: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Board of Governors is a seven-member body that oversees the Federal Reserve system, including emergency lending activities and orchestrating monetary policy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChristopher Waller also got the nod to the board, but he’s much less controversial than Shelton. We’ll explain. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eShelton has held some...unorthodox positions\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor a while, she advocated for a return to the gold standard, though more recently she’s backed off that highly unconventional idea. Her views on the Fed’s independence are now causing more sleep loss for legal and economic experts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe White House and the Fed are traditionally held as far apart as the parking lot and the concert venue. The distance is meant to enable the Fed to make decisions based on long-term economic trends, not short-term political interests. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut Shelton has questioned that separation. And she was an informal adviser to  President Trump’s 2016 campaign, leading some experts \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/07/21/judy-shelton-vote-fed/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto worry\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e she’d serve his goals. Trump also has been aggressively pressuring current Fed Chair Jerome Powell, which adds to their nightmares of a politicized Fed. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShelton may rise even higher than the Board. Some think that, if he’s reelected, Trump will nominate Shelton for Powell’s spot. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Fed and the central bankers who comprise it are \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/research/fed-response-to-covid19/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore crucial than ever\u003c/a\u003e as lawmakers and economists search for a way out of the current economic crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eShelton and Waller’s next (and final) stop on the nomination circuit is the full Senate, where President Trump’s Republican Party has a majority. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F07%2F21%2Fsenate-banking-committee-approves-controversial-trump-nomination-fed-board\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzk2L3NuYXBfZ2hvc3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSnap kicked off Q2 earnings for social media companies yesterday, and like receiving a Snapchat from your college ex, it was a mixed bag of emotions.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRevenue increased 17% annually to $454 million, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/snap-revenue-slows-but-sees-advertisers-ramping-up-11595362540?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeating\u003c/a\u003e estimates but giving away slowing growth. Snap said advertisers have upped spending in recent weeks, particularly in gaming and e-commerce. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDaily active users were also up 17% to 238 million, right in line with expectations. The company can at least high-five itself for creating a habit: It said the average user opened Snapchat 30x a day in Q2. Speaking of, please close Snapchat and continue reading this email. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe fun stuff\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast month, Snap \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/11/snap-unveils-new-entertainment-gaming-thirdparty-partnerships?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e the “Minis” developer platform, which allows third parties to run applications in Snap’s app. On Monday, the first Mini with meditation app Headspace \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/7/20/21331037/snapchat-headspace-meditation-mini-apps-mental-health?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e with six guided meditation exercises. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThree others drop this week, including study aid Flashcards, clairvoyance game Prediction Master, and Let’s Do It, which helps your friends make decisions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAgainst the backdrop of a Facebook boycott and last week’s Twitter hack, Snap’s holding steady. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSwap the mimosas for straight OJ, and you just might have a productive morning. On Monday, EU leaders reached an agreement on a momentous $857 billion \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/ac0ed55e49e362593dfe4081f9d84622?utm_source=piano\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=morningwire\u0026pnespid=lvtjsaRfAAmNpZS6uHzPJ5QyaBk8j6X9YkzMGihr\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecoronavirus recovery package\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEU members will sell bonds to raise the funds, which includes ~$450 billion in grants for countries hardest hit by COVID-19.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThey’ll remember this summit for years\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut not because of the chess, wine, movies, and hallway naps. It took four days of tense, draining negotiations for German Chancellor Angela Merkel and French President Emmanuel Macron to get “the frugals”—the Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, Finland, and Austria—on board. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe wealthy northern European countries were reluctant to send money to their southern neighbors and wanted strict spending oversight and labor market and pension reforms. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eItaly’s prime minister accused the holdups of “blackmailing” Europe and risking the bloc’s future. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTalks almost disintegrated as sleep-deprived leaders entered day 3. On day 4, aides “combed Brussels for extra underwear and fresh face masks,” Bloomberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-21/the-inside-story-of-how-europe-landed-its-massive-stimulus-plan?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut in a testament to the power of the German-French alliance (and a midnight bowl of cherries), a consensus was hammered out on Monday. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the National Women’s Soccer League (NWSL) announced a \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/christinasettimi/2020/07/21/serena-williams-natalie-portman-and-uswnt-legends-part-of-female-ownership-group-bringing-womens-professional-soccer-to-los-angeles/#47d791fd2767?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew team\u003c/a\u003e will come to Los Angeles in 2022. The name? Angel City...for now. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eA high-powered group of investors and celebs have been pushing for a Los Angeles women’s soccer team \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/21/vcs-celebrities-and-athletes-are-writing-a-new-la-story-to-bring-womens-soccer-to-the-city/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efor several years\u003c/a\u003e. And if you want to start something in LA, you do it through hard work and name dropping. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOscar winner Natalie Portman and Upfront Ventures partner Kara Nortman started the group with entertainment biz veteran Julie Uhrman, who serves as its president. Tennis superstar Serena Williams, actors such as Uzo Aduba and Eva Longoria, and former USWNT legends such as Mia Hamm and Julie Foudy are also involved. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWilliams’s husband, Reddit cofounder Alexis Ohanian, led the investment into Angel City.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith this kind of star power, the now-11 team NWSL is \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/howardmegdal/2020/07/21/nwsl-news-how-natalie-portman-serena-williams-and-nwsl-la-ownership-change-the-league/#38f62b741ab0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eready for the spotlight\u003c/a\u003e.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ The team doesn't have a permanent name, \u003c/strong\u003eprobably because Brew readers haven’t offered suggestions yet. The Los Angeles Açaí Bowls? The Los Angeles Aggressive Drivers?
